's too loud!" Lily tried to stop, but she couldn't. The microphone was broken. It kept making noise.
Lily felt scared and sad. She dropped the microphone and ran away. She cried all the way home. She wished she never sang for her friends. She wished she never had a microphone. She wished her dad was there to hug her. But he wasn't. He was far away, working. Lily felt alone and sorry. She had a bad day.

Once upon a time, there was a pencil. The pencil was broken. It was sad because it could not draw.
One day, the broken pencil met a little girl. The girl saw the pencil and wanted to help it. She picked up the pencil and took it home. She put tape around the pencil to fix it.
The next day, the pencil became magic. It could draw anything the girl wanted. The girl and the pencil were very happy. They drew pictures all day long. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once there was a little boy named Jack. He was very happy and liked to clap his hands. One day, while staring at the wall, he noticed it was broken. So he clapped his hands enthusiastically.
Jack's mom heard the noise and asked, "What happened, Jack?"
Jack replied, "The wall is broken and I'm clapping my hands."
Mom looked at the wall and then at her son. She smiled and said, "Let's fix the wall together."

One morning, the village had an earthquake. The ground shook and everyone was scared. Tim's mom held him tight and said, "Don't worry, Tim. We will be safe." After the earthquake stopped, the people in the village went outside to see if everything was okay.
Tim saw his broken toy car on the ground. He picked it up and saw that the earthquake had fixed his car! Tim was so happy that he could play with his car again. He stopped complaining and thanked the earthquake for fixing his favorite toy.

She gave him her fox and said, "This is my fox. He is soft and comfortable. You can hug him and he will make you feel better."

the ground, its leg was broken. Jane gasped in shock.

Jane gently picked up the ant and used the bandaid to put its leg back together. In no time, the ant was able to hop away happily.
Jane smiled and said, "See, your leg is all better now."

there was a little mouse. This mouse was weak and lived in a tiny hole in a big house. The mouse was sad because his hole was broken.
One day, the mouse decided to repair his hole. He looked for things to help him. He found some sticks and leaves. The mouse worked very hard to fix his hole.
After some time, the mouse repaired his hole. He was so happy! The little weak mouse now had a nice and safe home. The mouse was not sad anymore.

. The football got a hole and air came out. The football was broken. Tim was very sad and started to cry. He didn't know what to do.
Tim's mom saw him crying and asked, "Why are you crying, Tim?" Tim showed her the broken football. His mom hugged him and said, "Don't worry, Tim. We can get a new football for you."
Tim stopped crying and smiled. He was happy his mom would get him a new football. They went to the store and got a new football. Tim played with his new football every day and took good care of it.

The doctor said, "Look, there is a key inside your toy car!" Tim was so surprised! He never knew there was a key inside his toy car. The doctor took the key out, and Tim's toy car was fixed. Tim was happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a little angel. The angel had a toy car. The toy car was broken. The angel was sad.
One day, the angel's dad said he would repair the toy car. The angel was very happy and enthusiastic. They went to the garage to fix the toy car.
The angel and dad worked together. They repaired the toy car. The angel was so happy to play with the toy car again. They had a fun day playing together.

the ground and it was broken. Tim felt sad for her and wanted to help. He walked over to the girl and said, "Don't cry, you can have my ice cream cone." The girl stopped crying and smiled.
Tim's mom saw what happened and was very proud of him. She hugged Tim and said, "I'm so proud of you for sharing your ice cream with the little girl. That was very kind." Tim felt happy that he could help someone else.
The moral of the story is to always be kind and share with others. When you help someone, it can make both of you feel happy.
